Posts.Content: Hi, just diagnosed with BC-DCIS..But have been in back pain for over 3 weeks since the biopsy's done..And the there's also pain in my breast all the time..I told this to my BS and Onco they said it might the cause of the stereotactic procedure..It bothers me alot because it doesnt go away..I will be having lumpectomy surgery scheduled on  Oct.14th..I am so scared to death that the cancer has already spread to some other part of my body..How would we know if how are stages be diagnosed?..Is anyone has the same situation like mine..Any info would be greatly appreciated..My thoughts and prayers to all..
Posts.Title: re: just diagnosed BC-DCIS and back pain doesnt go away..

Posts.Content: On Sep 08, 2010 5:17 AM Michelle49 wrote: On Sep 07, 2010 1:08 AM lisa8282 wrote: Hi!  I have inflammatory breast cancer.  Is there anyone else on here that has it too?  I feel so alone, I have yet to talk with anyone else who has this rare cancer.    Hope to find someone soon.   Lisa I don't know if mine is the same, but I have infiltrating carcinoma of the breast which has spread to my bones.  I have been staged at IVb.  I would be glad to talk to you even if our cancers aren't exactly the same.  I'm not sure how this works as I just stumbled upon this website, but I'm assuming that I would get an email notification from you.  I will pray for you Lisa whether you contact me or not.  Michelle :) Hi!I am just diagnosed with breast cancer and am scared..I want to get some info re-breast cancer..Tomorrow i am scheduled to see the oncologist..I don't know what to expect but hope i can get some advice from you re-breast cancer  experienced ..I praying for all of us who happens to have this BC..May God protect us..GOD BLESS!
Posts.Title: inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi everyone! I just received news from my DR that i have cancer cell in my biopsy..Is anyone can give me some advice on what to do..I am scared and alone i need support from this site please?..I'll see the oncologist tomorrow for consultation on what to do..I have so much pain in my back and shoulder going down to my arm..I don't know if this is related to the procedure they have done at the radiologist office or because of the cancer cell..I will appreciate if someone could give me some advice on what to do..Thank you! My prayers to all of us here..GOD BLESS!
Posts.Title: Re: breast cancer cell

Posts.Content: On Sep 08, 2010 11:50 PM katrina49 wrote: Hi, i will pray for you. You should take it day to day, try not to think awful thought's. You may have the cancer that don't spread and caught early. I had the good cancer that does not spread and the bad cancer. I went from stage o to stage 2 after my biopsy a small lump was found behind my breast tissue. And i always stayed very positive. There is a breast cancer line you can call 24 hrs. it is called why me i do not have the number off hand but i will try to find it for you. I would like you to keep in touch if you ever want to talk let me know. you can call me. My name is Kathy and i am a five year cancer suvivor, take care, and think positive, i do know how you feel and sometimes when you get scared, just think that this is only temporary, i was diagnosed in 05 and i named my cancer Katrina and i fought it like my inside was a hurrican. It sounds kind of crazy but it helped because i was going to beet it. take care! Hi Katrina! Thank you very much for your reply..I appreciate your encouragement and advice..It's just so scared of what to expect..What are the procedures that you have done after finding that you had the cancer tissue..Did you have the mastectomy or surgery to remove the lump..And how painfull was that..Sorry if i ask so much question, i just want to get this out of my chest because it's killing mentally and physically..I hope i can overcome this and praying for all of us here who are in the same predicament..May God protect us and keep us under his care..
Posts.Title: Re: breast cancer cell

Posts.Content: On Sep 09, 2010 11:27 PM katrina49 wrote: Hi, i am so glad to help. I did had the first biospy, and then had a lumpectomy, and then when they found more cancer behind the breast tissue i had a double mascetomy. I also had reconstructive surgery. But everyone scenario is different. My mother was diagnosed two years prior to me and her cancer was the kind that don't spread so she had a lumpectomy. She had to have radiation a  small amount of chemo, i did not have to have radiation because their was nother to radiate because i had it all removed, breast, breast tissue and nipples, so i had reconstruction, with implants. And my mother and i are both survivor's and you will too, so don't be scared, and please ask any question at anytime. god bless you! Hi, Thank you very much for your info, it gives me some encouragement and not to be afraid..I don't know yet what my surgeon would say..The oncologist told me that i need to have a lumpectomy and radiation..But she said it depends what the surgeon would see inside..I hope and pray that he wouldn't find any more in other areas..How long is the lumpectomy and the radiation procedures done?..Was it painful?..How  long have you been a survivor?..Thanks again and God bless you!
Posts.Title: Re: breast cancer cell

Posts.Content: Hi! Just see the surgeon re surgery options procedures..He told me that my cancer not that clear in the mamogram how far the cancer cells extend..So he is thingking of the lumpectomy and see if he can remove all the areas affected by the cancer cells..And have again biopsy the tissue for farther diagnosed..It scares me because of this pain that i have constantly..The schedule for surgery would be 3 weeks from today due to lump developed after the biopsy..He wanted the lump to subside so it will not interfere with the removing of the tissues..The problem is my breast is in pain all the time and back going to my arms hurts too..Is anyone has some problem like this?..I would appreciate some advice on what to do..Hugs and prayers to all!..GOD BLESS!
Posts.Title: Re: Pain in my breast all the time

Posts.Content: On Sep 13, 2010 4:47 PM Oncrx wrote: lumpectomy and radiation should be fine.  No spread if its really DCIS.  You could need tamoxifen depending on your ER/PR status.  Dont worry, it sounds like you caught it early.  Nearly 100% cure for DCIS. Thanks so much for your reply, it really gives me some encouragement and praying that this is really in the early stage and could catch up early cure or prevent from growing..My prayers to all of us that has the same situation..I'll keep posted till the surgeon would tell me something new or decission that i have to do..GOD BLESS!
Posts.Title: Need some support on what to do Re: DCIS

Posts.Content: On Sep 19, 2010 4:01 AM chitown1021 wrote: Hi, rlinda... first of all please know you are in my thoughts and prayers... I'm 57, diagnosed with DCIS (left breast) a few weeks ago - no prev. history and it was a shock - confirmed w/ stereotactic biopsy, had a lumpectomy last week and thank the Lord, the path. report came back clear. Had to wait 3 weeks between the biopsy and my first surgical consult because the doctor was out of town and it was one long anxiety attack! So sorry to hear you're having breast and back pain, I had something similar - developed a LARGE (2-3" dia.) hematoma after the biopsy, felt like a big scary lump and was quite sensitive, had a hard time sleeping due to soreness, etc.. Luckily my surgeon (who was great) drained this during the lumpectomy. Ask your doctor or nurse about this, also try using warm compresses (and maybe Tylenol) to relieve discomfort. As for feeling alone, please know you are not. Hopefully you have a good medical team to help support you, as well as your husband. Have faith... you will get through this! Hi chitown..Thank you for your advice..How are you doing?..For me still in pain, breast and back..I am waiting till monday to call the nurse or doctor for some advice or medication..It really get to me when it doesnt stop even when i am sleeping..The lump still there, i don't know if it will get smaller or the same till my surgery..Maybe they do the same with yours that they drain it..I hope this is over for all of us, but, this is still the beginning of everything..I will keep posting with my development on my situation..By the way, did you have any lump before the stereotactic biopsy?...Or they found it during your regular yearly mamo...Please keep posted...My thoughts and prayers are with you!.. GOD BLESS!
Posts.Title: Need some support on what to do Re: DCIS

Posts.Content: Went to see the BS and he showed me the mamogram and i got a little bit scared because what it shows in the mamo..He said that the cells that was in the mamo looks like there were few of the them but, he cannot be sure how far the cells went because it's at the end of the picture..It can be more that the mamo wasn't able to get..It really freaks me out.. He said that he hoped that nothing more further than what it's seen the mamo..He cannot promise that this is purely "DCIS" untill he'll see inside..Scares me to death..But i trust the LORD..I have pain constantly in my breast and back, don't know if this is caused by the biospsy procedure..I will be scheduled to have the surgery 3 weeks after due to the lump developed after the biopsy..It's killing me slowly..Feeling so alone i don't even have the courage to tell my family except to my husband coz it will crash them..I know they have lots of problem in the lives i don't want them to worry more..So pretty much i am alone dealing with this..That's why i am here to get some support on what to do to get through with this..I hope everyone would understand and help get through..My prayers to all!..
Posts.Title: Need some support on what to do Re: DCIS

Posts.Content: On Sep 19, 2010 4:43 AM Loula wrote: Hi Rlinda, Just read your message about your DCIS.  I hope and pray for you that it is only stage 1and that it has not left the ducts.  It is so scary being told that you have cancer but you must decide to fight it and not let it get the better of you.  I know it is difficult to stay positive when faced with such a dreadful condition, however, it can be overcome - especially in its early stages!   If you are feeling very weak you need to have blood tests to determine any defficiencies and act accordingly.  Your treating doctor should already be on top of this provided you have told him of your weakness.  It is very important to eat lots of raw vegetables and take supplements to boost your immune system so that your body has the strength to fight the cancer and to help you recover from any treatment that you decide to have.  I'm sorry to say that I cannot advise you on what to do as far as what treatment to have.  Only you can make that decision for yourself.  What I can say to you is you can tegrate (combine) natural medicine with orthodox medicine quite well.  You might want to see a Naturopath and seek some help and guidence there?  When I was diagnosed 1 year ago it had already spread beyond the milk ducts to the lymph nodes and the right lung.  I have been doing only alternative medicine because I did not believe that I would cope well with conventional medicine since I don't handle pain very well.  When I was diagnosed my cancer marker (CA 15.3) was 59.  I managed to reduce it down to 35 (30 being normal) using alternative treatments only.  Until about 3 months ago I was managing it quite well but after some manipulation of the left armpit to aleviate pain, it seemed to get out of control and my cancer marker has been gradually rising.  I had a blood test done last Friday and I am anxiously awaiting the results.  Once again I wish you well.  Please let us know how you go with the rest of your tests.  Loula Hi Loula,            Thank your input..I hope and pray that your blood test result will be good..Did you have any surgery?..How did they diagnosed you?..Did you have too stereotactic biopsy?..What treatment procedures they gave you?..Sorry if i am asking too much..I just want to know the different procedures and treatment that are available and suitable for us..It really does take away everything from the normal life we have..I cannot even concentrate on something because i am thingking of death..It's so scary..For now i just have lot crying and praying..But I trust the Lord..And I pray for everyone here who has the same situations..I will keep posting on how i go with everything.. Wish you well too..And May God protect us and keep us under his care.. linda
Posts.Title: Need some support on what to do Re: DCIS

Posts.Content: Hi everyone!           I have just diagnosed with DCIS and am about to scheduled for lumpectomy..But haven't yet seen the surgeon till this weds. Can anyone could tell me on what to do re decission..Onco told me that this an early stage but actually i really don't feel well everyday..I am so weak and my whole body aches or have pain..Am so scared that it could spread to other areas that they haven't determine yet"GOD FORBID"..Please anyone who has the same situations could help me, so i would know on what to do..I would appreciate for any info and praying that everyone here will be in God's protection and hoping that all of us will get through with this..GOD BLESS US ALL!
Posts.Title: Need some support on what to do Re: DCIS

Posts.Content: On Sep 20, 2010 1:57 AM chitown1021 wrote: On Sep 19, 2010 7:29 PM rlinda7358 wrote: On Sep 19, 2010 4:01 AM chitown1021 wrote: Hi, rlinda... first of all please know you are in my thoughts and prayers... I'm 57, diagnosed with DCIS (left breast) a few weeks ago - no prev. history and it was a shock - confirmed w/ stereotactic biopsy, had a lumpectomy last week and thank the Lord, the path. report came back clear. Had to wait 3 weeks between the biopsy and my first surgical consult because the doctor was out of town and it was one long anxiety attack! So sorry to hear you're having breast and back pain, I had something similar - developed a LARGE (2-3" dia.) hematoma after the biopsy, felt like a big scary lump and was quite sensitive, had a hard time sleeping due to soreness, etc.. Luckily my surgeon (who was great) drained this during the lumpectomy. Ask your doctor or nurse about this, also try using warm compresses (and maybe Tylenol) to relieve discomfort. As for feeling alone, please know you are not. Hopefully you have a good medical team to help support you, as well as your husband. Have faith... you will get through this! Hi chitown..Thank you for your advice..How are you doing?..For me still in pain, breast and back..I am waiting till monday to call the nurse or doctor for some advice or medication..It really get to me when it doesnt stop even when i am sleeping..The lump still there, i don't know if it will get smaller or the same till my surgery..Maybe they do the same with yours that they drain it..I hope this is over for all of us, but, this is still the beginning of everything..I will keep posting with my development on my situation..By the way, did you have any lump before the stereotactic biopsy?...Or they found it during your regular yearly mamo...Please keep posted...My thoughts and prayers are with you!.. GOD BLESS! Hi again, rlinda - I had no lump before the biopsy. What happened was, a week after my annual mammogram, my gyn. asked me to return so they could get another image of my left breast. This confirmed the presence of microcalcifications. I had the stereotactic biopsy a few days later. Afterwards, I was black and blue, and the lump (hematoma) developed. I was scared this would interfere with the surgery, but my doctor reassured me it wouldn't. (P.S. My breast is swollen from the lumpectomy, but this is not unusual and the doctor said it would recede within a few weeks.) I'm truly sorry you're still in so much pain, and hope your doctor can help. Again, you are in my prayers. Please let me know how you are doing. Hi chitown, Your situation is just like mine..so maybe we will have the same journey from here on..Its just you, dont have the pain..So what's next for you..Are you going to have radiation?..Does your swollen from lumpectomy hurts or have pain?..I am praying for you!...Am calling now my dr's office for the lumpectomy schedule..I want this over so bad, its killing me mentally, emotinally and physically..I cant consentrate on anything..I'm sorry i am just a very weak person when it comes to this..Please understand!..I hope and pray that everything will go well with you..Please keep us inform about your development..Hugs and prayers..
Posts.Title: Need some support on what to do Re: DCIS
